page.title: 01COXHEATH - GENERAL REVIEW
page.content:
The Coxheath area is mostly estate housing built in the last twenty years and most properties are owner-occupied. Outside the housing area most of the land is fruit farming land. In the eastern part of the area is the village of Loose. This is a lower stretch of land and has a much older selection of buildings.
Coxheath was an army camp at about the time of the Napoleonic wars but there is no longer an army connection with the area with the possible exception of a troop review by the {Duke of {York}of 10000 soldiers on August 20th. 1804 which could have led to the nursery rhyme.
